subject: Cybersecurity
title: Bug Bounties: Paying Hackers to Hack You
description: A fast breakdown of Bug Bounties: Paying Hackers to Hack You for builders.

hook.text: Google, Apple, and the Pentagon all pay strangers to find holes in their systems. On purpose.

buildup.text: Bug bounty programs reward researchers who responsibly report vulnerabilities instead of exploiting them.

discovery.text: Platforms like HackerOne have paid over $300 million to ethical hackers. Some researchers earn six figures.

twist.text: The alternative is worse: if you don't pay for bugs, criminals will find them first â€” and sell them.

climax.text: Bug bounties turned hacking from a crime into a career path with a clear ethical framework.

punchline.text: The smartest defense is paying people to attack you.

quiz.question: What is a bug bounty program?
options: Paying researchers to find and report vulnerabilities
